column4: I wish the @POTUS and @FLOTUS a swift recovery from COVID-19. The Coronavirus is a very real threat that our nation is still fighting to overcome. We must all continue to do our part in keeping each other safe and healthy.

FEMA grants have been made available to help American families and individuals struggling with lost wages due to COVID-19. As the pandemic continues, I call on Gov. Newsom to act swiftly in securing this critical assistance for the State of California. https://t.co/o5UM3fpwEL

We’re making progress in combatting COVID-19, but HR 6800 wastes precious time and money. Instead of working together to help American families & small businesses, the House majority put forward an unfocused partisan bill that has no chance of becoming law https://t.co/XeQJ9WK9oC

Nurses risk their own health every day to care for our communities during normal circumstances, and now on the frontlines of this pandemic. Let us honor their heroism by staying home and practicing safe social distancing measures. Thank you to all nurses. #NationalNursesWeek https://t.co/3Ikppl0PMI

My colleagues and I sent a letter to Gov. Gavin Newsom. Congress intended for the COVID-19 funds provided to the State of California to be passed down, in part, to areas that didn’t receive money directly, not for the money to remain idle in Sacramento. https://t.co/ZbiftSm8eL

My colleagues and I sent a letter to Congressional leaders addressing the lack of COVID-19 funds for small/midsize counties including @InyoCounty and @CountyofMono. We need to ensure ALL our counties have adequate resources. https://t.co/gHuG4YemBX

Attention Veterans: Under Secretary for Benefits, Dr. Paul R. Lawrence is hosting a #Veterans Tele-Townhall tomorrow, 4/28 at 1:00pm PT. The call will be focused on the #COVID19 response and Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) program updates. To call-in, dial (844) 227-7557. https://t.co/tsdeJqV9Y8

The House passed HR 266 with overwhelming bipartisan support. The COVID-19 pandemic continues to wreak havoc on the lives of Americans. It’s critical that we provide support to our small businesses and protect the physical health of all Americans. 
https://t.co/IwgchmKbJ3

Today is #NationalDoctorsDay. Let's show our gratitude and honor all of our doctors and healthcare workers. Now more than ever, they need our support as they risk their lives each day in the battle against COVID-19. Thank you for your unwavering dedication and heroism. https://t.co/tc2Yr5SMGB

For those of you who’ve asked how you can help fight the Coronavirus, please visit this page on the FEMA website:

https://t.co/4KE9WAgqb0

I hope everyone is staying safe and healthy at home. With all the changes happening each day, there are many questions and concerns. Please visit the COVID-19 Resource Center on my website for important information and resources that are here to help you.
https://t.co/LiTocumzDn

(2/2) I’m proud to support this cost-effective legislation that will ensure resources are directed to where they are needed. We must be proactive in preventing the spread of Coronavirus. https://t.co/vu5XZHhEny

(1/2) I just voted for the bipartisan Families First Coronavirus Response Act, which passed the House overwhelmingly. This bill provides free testing for those who need it and financial assistance for those hard-working Americans who are impacted by the virus.

I’m deeply disappointed in Senator Schumer and Senate Democrats for shutting down government. The CR provided health care for over 9 million children and crucial funding for our military and national defense. Here's my full statement: https://t.co/mOnnXritlQ #SchumerShutdown
The VA needs a culture change. VA Secretary McDonald compares health care lines to the lines at Disney. Disgraceful. https://t.co/d4MyTFduNH
My staff presented at the Joint High Desert Behavioral Health Symposium in #Victorville this morning. http://t.co/tHCBprfyFU
On the 5th anniversary of #Obamacare, I still believe health insurance policies should be based on individual choices, not what gov says.
Doris Davies Park in #Victorville is now open! Thanks to Kaiser and St. Joe's Health System for the grants to build. http://t.co/qVCyp80CAn
Tonight, I voted for H.R. 294 to expand healthcare choices for #veterans. http://t.co/eQHDBpNqES  #CA08 http://t.co/XUsURrn4LI
RT @DDispatchNews: Barstow college showcases new Performing Arts Center http://t.co/JAtVCVIWFr
Former #Hesperia teacher encourages kids to get healthy! Great job, Cindie (h/t @HesperiaStar)  http://t.co/PEQ5u6KdbF #CA08
RT @SupervisorJosie: Support 28 local farmers & your family's health, join the DT San Ber. Farmshare! 13 weeks of fruits/veggies, app here …
RT @MyCraftonHills CHC was selected to offer a bachelor degree in Emergency Services & Allied Health Systems! http://t.co/VfHOtNUnZC
The #ClayHuntSAVAct will increase access to mental health care at the #VA. Read why I voted for it here --> http://t.co/DaS7TVKV4x
RT @calhealthcare: Thank you @RepPaulCook for cosponsoring the Protect Medical #Innovation Act to #repeal the medical #devicetax! #RepealDe…
#Ebola is a serious global health challenge facing US -@YucaipaNewsMirr published an editorial I wrote on the matter http://t.co/DkJUVr3WCY
RT @SupervisorRamos Join me and @SBCVitalSigns for a forum in JT to transform the County into a healthier place! @CountyWire @SBCVision
"Gov. has no business collecting & holding your personal health info online." Read more from my oped --> http://t.co/sBlL5Ha4vr @PEcom_news
Voted for #HR3522 ,Employee Health Care Protection Act, to allow workers to keep their health plans in the group health insurance market.
